verses.text: "The eye that mocks a father, that scorns obedience to a mother, will be pecked out by the ravens of the valley, will be eaten by the vultures.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:15–31
rsbNotes.text: 30:15–31 On the form of these numerical sayings, see notes 6:16–19.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:17
rsbNotes.text:
30:17 The eye that mocks. The contemptuous look can be as poisonous as words. Dishonor toward parents, evidence of breakdown in the most basic human relationship, deserves the ultimate curse.

picked . . . ravens. The words portray the fate of the corpse that lies unburied, with special attention to the offending eye.
